resources.string:
Welcome Screen
• Tap the upper left icon or flick to the right from the left edge of the screen to open the menu .

Main Menu
• This shows the basic options the user can use. This includes Camera, Plant List, The Application and Open Source Licenses.


Camera
• Allows you to access the phone’s camera to take pictures for recognition.


Plant List
• Allows you to view the list of plant recognized by this application.


The Application
• Informs you about the applications features, Help section, Update section and Developers Section.


Open Source Licenses
• Licenses of the libraries used for making this application.

Launch Camera
• Tap on the camera icon to open camera view and start capturing a plant.

1. View Toggle (to List View)

• This shows the list of herbal plants recognized by the application in list view. This is the default view for smart phone devices.

• Tap upper right button to change view.


2. View Toggle (to *Grid View)

• This shows the list of herbal plants recognized by the application in grid view. This is the default view for tablet devices.

• Tap upper right button to change viewn.



*NOTICE[BETA]:

• Some users may encounter wrong image presentation while viewing Grid View mode running on Gingerbread 2.3.6 (API 10). This is caused by slow Read/Write by the device.

Detailed View

• This is the detailed view of every plant in the list. It includes the plant’s pictures, name, scientific name, common name, vernacular name, properties, usage, and availability.


• Web search button is available to give more information about the plant selected.

Expandable Sections

• This shows the expanded version of the detailed view of every plant. When you click on the main list, it will show all the items under that list.

Full Image View

• Tap on the plant\'s picture and you will see the full view of the image.

• Pinch to zoom the picture.

Search

• This application is also capable of searching for specific plant in the list. Upon entering your query, the list automatically lists all matching entries.

Search

• An example of using the search functionality. The user typed in “sa”, the application then displays the list of plants that contains with “sa”. Search basis is upon the plant’s name OR plant’s common name.

Sub Menus

• This contains the additional actions of the application which includes Help, Update, Developers, About.

Help
• Displays the manual on how to use the application.

Update
• Checks for updates and ask for confirmation if a recent update is available.

Developers
• The developers involved in making this app possible.

About
• Discusses the purpose of the application.
